text: It's selected as an H1 on the right in the design manager. That will lock it down in the editor.

Hello all, 
I am currently utilizing the "Martech" theme for my new website. I have gone into global settings and changed my colors, fonts, etc. However, I want to be able to have the website menu stay visual on the page as I scroll down. How do I accomplish this or what snidbit of code can I apply to this page for that function to happen. I also want to be able to remove the green hover color on the top bar navigation. 
 
Please help Thank you in advance.

HubSpot TEAM:  I'm curious what the intention is behind making custom modules within a theme read-only?

I can for-see this being an issue when helping customers with a customization to a module or small bug/css fix.   I understand why locking the theme file may be important but wonder about the custom modules.
For us, it's to prevent any changes in the cloud IDE at all and force all changes to come from GitHub so there isn't a version conflict
What is the use of having the possibility to change in design manager and then in page editing I can't do anything anymore?
